Class ec.ifc.stonelook.SLScrollBar

Class ec.ifc.stonelook.SLScrollBar 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----netscape.application.View
           |
           +----netscape.application.ScrollBar
                   |
                   +----ec.ifc.stonelook.SLScrollBar
public class SLScrollBar
extends ScrollBar
implements HasColorScheme
Subclass of ScrollBar that applies the stone-texture look. SLScrollGroup uses these by default, so if you're using an SLScrollGroup you don't need to worry about modifying the appearance further.
See Also:
SLScrollGroup

SLScrollBar(int, int, int, int, int)
Creates a new SLScrollBar with the stone-texture look.

addParts()
Overridden to position buttons properly (ScrollBar insets them by one pixel from each edge).
drawView(Graphics)
Overridden to draw the guts of the scroll bar differently.
drawViewKnobInRect(Graphics, Rect)
Overridden to draw the knob differently.
getColorScheme()
Returns the color scheme for this scroll bar -- one of the set specified by class StoneLook.
minSize()
Overridden to not assume a border around the buttons.
scrollTrayRect()
Overridden to eliminate the one-pixel border added by ScrollBar
setColorScheme(int)
Sets the color scheme for this scroll bar, and schedules a redraw.

SLScrollBar 
  public SLScrollBar(int x,
                     int y,
                     int width,
                     int height,
                     int orientation)
Creates a new SLScrollBar with the stone-texture look.

addParts 
  public void addParts()
Overridden to position buttons properly (ScrollBar insets them by one pixel from each edge).
Overrides:
addParts in class ScrollBar
drawView 
  public void drawView(Graphics g)
Overridden to draw the guts of the scroll bar differently.
Overrides:
drawView in class ScrollBar
drawViewKnobInRect 
  public void drawViewKnobInRect(Graphics g,
                                 Rect rect)
Overridden to draw the knob differently.
Overrides:
drawViewKnobInRect in class ScrollBar
getColorScheme 
  public int getColorScheme()
Returns the color scheme for this scroll bar -- one of the set specified by class StoneLook. The default is StoneLook.BLUES.
minSize 
  public Size minSize()
Overridden to not assume a border around the buttons.
Overrides:
minSize in class ScrollBar
scrollTrayRect 
  public Rect scrollTrayRect()
Overridden to eliminate the one-pixel border added by ScrollBar
Overrides:
scrollTrayRect in class ScrollBar
setColorScheme 
  public void setColorScheme(int newColorScheme)
Sets the color scheme for this scroll bar, and schedules a redraw.
See Also:
